summary: The House of Commons is the lower house of the UK Parliament. It has 650 elected members called MPs, who represent different areas. They meet in London's Palace of Westminster. The house has a long history, starting in the 13th century as the English Commons. Over time, it expanded to include representatives from Scotland, Ireland, and finally, in 1922, Northern Ireland, becoming the House of Commons of the United Kingdom. The MPs in this house can make laws, and the government must answer to them.
title: House of Commons of the United Kingdom
